text: is it possible to run code at specific time? like I deploy some chaincode that will do something in a week?
without me having to invoke anything in a week
<@U1JB7QCBD> there is no “timer” or “crontab” like facility today
it has been talked about before though
<@U18D82GJH>: there is no support for creating/deploying chaincode instances (ie, based on one chaincode). One approach could be to use state to represent instances in a single chaincode
^^^ I’m sure that occured to you as well… added it more for completeness.
Thanks <@U0ULK2JPP> .. Curious too know why is it not supported multiple instantiation on same contract ?
To build a contract that should (& must) be used between mutually exclusive parties (e.g., partyA-partyB  & partyX-partyY) would mean compiling & building same contract multiple times.
I know in Etherium you can deploy same contract multiple times which returns different address everytime.
<@U18D82GJH>: nothing against it.  just resource constraints and prioritization.
ah.. ohk… So it is in future plan.. But right now not supported... thanks so much!
It could be in future plan :slightly_smiling_face:
will also add <@U0KPFAZNF> has quite a few ideas in that space
certainly an area where contribution is welcome…. and a few of us can help
Would def. love to! just getting hang of the ecosystem...
